topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
A small rant:

One of the worst things I can think of for a critic to do is to claim that for whatever reason they personally are immune to criticism. 

A prime example of this is Yahtzee*, who openly holds people who comment on his videos in contempt if they disagree with him and commits the sin of cherry picking only the insane/blitheringly stupid criticisms of his own work to respond to in a public fashion.

Additionally he also dodges the criticism by claiming that his opinions should be of no consequence if you disagree with him on the grounds that he has no personal power to enforce them, which seems reasonable but which strikes me as a fallacious argument.

That might work if you are just shooting the shit with friends in a private conversation and some stranger feels the need to but in and tell you how wrong you are, however if you make a statement and then put it out into any sort of public forum such as the internet, a print magazine, a tv show, ect. for the purpose of massively distributing to the general public then you have forfeited your right to say "fuck off, its just my opinion."

You have just made yourself a public figure however minor that may be and so you have opened yourself up to receiving criticism from people who expect you to intelligently support your goddamn bullshit.

The same sort of behavior is all over the internet really, as if people are not aware that they are in fact in public after a fashion and no one feels the need to think about the insane bullshit they spout.

It irritates me is all, people do not think about their beliefs and opinions and then expect them to be taken seriously merely because they are their beliefs and opinions. It is my hope that I do not behave in such a fashion. I know I have spoken out of anger or just off the cuff here and in other places, and I do hope that people will call me out when I'm full of shit as it is the only way to learn and test the ideas and opinions I value.

*Note: While I am critical of Yahtzee, I do in fact enjoy his videos about half the time.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
you know, there has been this rumor, that stefan burnett died during the making of GP.

this is said because after NLDW ride wasnt seen at all, all of DG´s concerts were cancelled with the excuse of making the album, and after niggas was dropped they disbanded and of course, mc hasnt been seen.

this rumor is fueled by the fact niggas barely uses mc vocals, which leade sto believe it was reusing unused materials.

also fueled by the fact goverment plates only has 1 video where mc ride is shown, the rest are cgi videos, and niggas on the moon features no videos.

the creppiest thing is, during the last goverment plates video, at the end a guy with a skeleton mask enters a room, and then points at mc ride who is just there, not moving, barely shows breathing, staring at the ceiling.

then the guy in the skeleton mask starts sobbing and then a speech bubble appears saying "i told you".

listening to albums about a person who you dont know is dead or not is kind of creepy.

but im sure nobody would care since nobody listens to DG.
